DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate effect easy access emergency contraceptive pill ( ECPs ) rate pregnancy sexually transmit infection ( STIs ) .
DOC.detailed_description: ECPs back-up contraceptive method indicate prevention pregnancy sexual intercourse primary contraceptive method fails use . This trial determine increase access ECPs affect probability pregnancy three STIs . The STIs test study chlamydia , gonorrhea , trichomonas . The trial also evaluate ready access ECPs influence contraceptive STI-prevention behavior , particularly use ECPs , use condom , use contraceptive method . The trial conduct among 1,490 young woman United States high risk pregnancy STIs . Sexually active woman age 14 24 year use barrier method contraception , oral contraceptive pill , contraception enrol . Each woman randomly assign either Advance Provision group Standard Care group . In Advance Provision group , woman give supply ECPs free charge keep home case need . In Standard Care group , woman counsel ECPs invite come clinic obtain usual clinic charge necessary . Participants see follow-up Months 6 12 . At visit , participant ask pregnancy , STIs , sexual activity , self-assessed STI pregnancy risk , use ECPs contraceptive method . A specimen obtain chlamydia , gonorrhea , trichomonas testing .
